content.raw:
> Are we okay with fixing the number of axes?

That's already fixed on SDF.  Gazebo-classic supports ball joints, which have 3 axes, but it provides no API for interacting with the axes one-by-one. If a time comes when we want to improve support for 3-axes-joints, we could add a new element to the struct and bump the version... Or we can just add it now for future-proofing. Do we want to add up to 6 axes to cover the free-joint case? :thinking:

>  Do we want to put it on the user to know which axes are valid based on the joint type?

I think we should protect against the user trying to access a non-existent axis, but were you thinking of something else?
